channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: #86 - Tasty, not Testy, Testing
item.description:
This week it is Yanick again, I just added a few of the Perl Maven entries, but let's see what Yanick Champoux has to share:

On the menu this week: minor releases of perl to address the rehashing flaw recently discovered. Plus a few articles dealing with tests; how to manage them efficiently, and how work around those that cause us grief.

item.title: MediaMath is hiring Perl Developers: Are you tired of Perl 'scripting'?
item.description: Come join an innovative talented engineering department where you can do some serious Perl programming in a great development environment with clean codebase that is not slapped together. If interested in learning more please contact Marc Spinowitz, Recruiter at MediaMath at mspinowitz@mediamath.com or 646-532-5914

item.title: Adestra are hiring Perl developers to work on our Modern Perl/Catalyst/Moose/DBIC codebase.
item.description: Come and work for our small development team based in Oxford, UK where you can make a real impact, and have an opportunity to work on every aspect of our infrastructure from UI design to scaling. Get in touch at jobs@adestra.com.

item.title: Perl 5.16.3 and 5.14.4 just released
item.description: New releases addressing the recently discovered rehashing flaw.

item.title: Strawberry Perl (for Windows) 5.16.3.1 + 5.14.4.1 released
item.description: Strawberry Perl echoes the core mothership and releases two new versions addressing the rehashing flaw.

item.title: perl101.org needs a new maintainer
item.description: Andy Lester doesn't have the time required to work on perl101.org, and need somebody to take on the torch. Could that be you?

item.title: YAPC::NA Austin - Call for speakers extended to end of month
item.description: Oh dearie me, you wanted to submit a talk for YAPC::NA, but forgot about the deadline? You're in luck: the staff kinda did the same. Clear outcome: the deadline is extended till the end of the month.

item.title: PrePAN module discussion project
item.description: PrePAN, a platform available to discuss new Perl module ideas, is now AWS hosted, and in a move that promise synergic goodness, their team has joined the MetaCPAN team.

item.title: Perl News - let us know about your big story
item.description: The Perl News, Leo Lapworth let us know, is looking for stories, events, milestones pertaining to Perl. Have something to share, hop on IRC and tell them your stories.

item.title: Perl versions usage stats (with cpanm)
item.description: The last release of cpanm added the version of the running perl to cpanm's user-agent signature. miyagawa compiled the results for our pie-viewing pleasure.

item.title: Upgrade in Place with Perlbrew
item.description: Did you know that you can upgrade your perl via perlbrew without having to reinstall all of your libraries? If not, chromatic will show you how.

item.title: Perl modules on CPAN and github
item.description: Several activities streams converge in Oylenshpeegul's entry, in which the discussion about improving CPAN/Github interaction, the newest cpanm features, and a bug in Config::Simple all crash together.

item.title: Perl5i Quickstart Guide
item.description: Perl5i is an experimental fork of perl spearheaded by Schwern where features long-desired but problematic, usualy because of the need for backward-compatibility, are gleefully injected in the language. Intrigued? With this new quickstart guide, it is now much easier for you to experience this alternate-reality perl first-hand...

item.title: I love CPANtesters and Travis-CI
item.description: Joel Berger professes his love for the ever-vigilant CPANtesters, as well as for a (relative) newcomer in the Open Source testing scene, Travis-CI, and narrates how they both helping him troubleshoot his spiffy Galileo CMS project.

item.title: Discoverable tests and creating testing standards
item.description: You have so many tests associated with your perl code that it's becoming a problem to wade through it in search of a specific testcase? Oh, how do I envy you. But still, Ovid proposes a standard (with heplful vim scripts) to make things as neat and as organized as possible.

item.title: Stop Pod tests before they stop you!
item.description: Some authors bundle POD tests in their distribution, which has little value to the end-user. David Golden got tired of those, and introduces a new test harness that transparently skip those pesky tests.

item.title: Using Roles with Test::Class::Moose
item.description: Just like Moose can tremendously simplify your OO classes, Test:::Class::Moose can do wonders for your test suites. Ovid shows us how it can leverage inheritance and roles to great advantages.

item.title: How I'm using Dist::Zilla to give credit to contributors
item.description: Never underestimate the power of a well-placed "thank you". David Golden shows how one can easily, and automatically, give credit to everyone who contribute to a distribution, with a little bit of Dist::Zilla help.

item.title: Introducing Platform
item.description: Toby Inkster proposes a new way to declare that a module would only run on certain platforms.

item.title: Deprecated modules warn when they are used
item.description: How do you know when a CORE module is deprecated? brian d foy tells you where to look to figure it out.

item.title: Recursive deferred promises
item.description: Sawyer X's vouches that reading his blog entry will open your eyes to the wonderful world of deferred promises. I vow he's right.

item.title: Text::Fuzzy now with transpositions
item.description: Ben Bullock announces a new version of Text::Fuzzy, a module that has nothing to do with ursine muppets, and eveverything with dealing with text written by humans, and thus subject to msitakes.

item.title: Getting started with Rakudo * (2013.01) on Windows
item.description: The monthly release of Rakudo Star - the Perl 6 distributions that includes the Perl 6 compiler, the Parrot VM and a bunch of Perl 6 modules, is also distributed in MSI formate. This is how you can try it.

item.title: How to create an Indian Rupee symbol with Perl code
item.description: For people who need to deal with Unicode.

item.title: Bem vindo futuro conhecedor em Perl!
item.description: Thanks to Felipe Leprevost there is the beginning of the Brazilian Portuguese version of the Perl Maven site.

item.title: Swiss Perl Workshop 2013
item.description: March 22, 2013, Bern, Switzerland

item.title: Dutch Perl Workshop 2013
item.description: April 19, 2013, Arnhem, The Netherlands

item.title: DC Baltimore Perl Workshop
item.description: April 20, 2013, Baltimore, DC, USA

item.title: Polish Perl Workshop 2013
item.description: May 25-26, 2013, Warsaw, Poland
